name: Thespie
slogan: Goodreads for theatre: a cross-media discovery hub for theatre and the arts
description: Thespie is a theatre platform that helps people explore theatre online, watch/listen/read theatre-related media, and buy tickets directly from theatres. Emulating the models of Netflix and Goodreads we're building robust discovery mechanisms, data-driven recommendations, and next generation tools to engage with theatre and other performing arts.

jobs.title: Experienced Marketing Leader - Theatre
jobs.description:
We are looking for an experienced marketing leader with an impressive set of achievements at either a leading theatre organisation, customer-centric technology company, or a fast-paced startup. This role will drive user acquisition, brand awareness, and arts advocacy efforts for our next-generation theatre discovery platform. This is ideally a full-time hire, or could be part-time/contract for the right candidate who has the right capabilities and a passion for what we are doing for the industry.

Scope:
This role will oversee user acquisition, retention, and media/communications working closely with the Founder/CEO, and taking ownership of all channels, testing, messaging, as well as developing of a menu of ad products for our theatre suppliers. You will manage agency relationships and help build the marketing and communications team as we scale.

Who you will be: 
- Passionate about theatre and the opportunity to use technology to increase access and decrease friction for all segments, including the less tech-savvy and new/infrequent theatregoers.
- Highly analytical, wired to make decisions based on data, balanced with strong instincts about what's right for our users and brand.
- Experienced in all aspects of digital marketing and comfortable owning an entire marketing program (organic & paid social, SEO/SEM, PR, partnerships, content marketing, video/photography, events, etc.) 
- Knowledgeable about UK customer segments (and regional/demographic language nuances) and able to craft messaging that captures attention, compels trial and builds trust.
- Understand the perspective of theatre marketers (in-house and agencies) and their challenges in building new audiences and selling out their shows, so we can develop solutions that aid their efforts. 
- A natural do-er, with bias for action/speed and a test-and-learn mentality. 
- Frugal and scrappy, willing to pitch in and help execute from the outset, growing the team as we scale.
- Enjoys light-weight processes, inexpensive/simple tools, semi-solutions, and bringing order to chaos. 
- Willing to see beyond a role remit and collaboratively contribute to all areas of the business.

What we offer: 
- Chance to join an early-stage technology start-up setting out to make a material difference in the way people discover and engage with theatre. 
- Mentorship and camaraderie from an experienced team of technologists who love theatre and care about improving people's lives through the work we do. 
- Pay depends on level of experience. Full-time, part-time, or contract feasible depending on any accommodations required for the right candidate.

We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, citizenship, disability, or veteran status.

jobs.title: Senior Frontend or Full-stack Engineer (React, Next.js)
jobs.description:
We are looking for a Frontend or Full-stack Engineer to join us, ideally on a full-time basis to help us continue to scale and enhance our theatre discovery platform. We're really proud of the product we've built, are getting great response from our users and the theatre industry. We have a clear, exciting roadmap of enhancements and innovations ahead of us and are looking to add more bench strength to an already strong team so we can accelerate progress. 

Our team:
We're a pretty focused and skilled bunch based in London. We love feedback and collaboration and have lots of exciting problems to solve, so would love to find someone that cares about our mission: to remove barriers-to-entry for potential theatre-goers and be the most trusted way to access theatre. 

You:
Ideally you care deeply about clean code, scalable solutions and delivering scrappy but error-free enhancements for users. So ideally looking for someone with deep experience in quickly implementing straightforward solutions. We are not interested in giving you a list of tasks - we need you to bring your passion, problem-solving and curiosity to our work everyday. Our diversity of perspectives helps us find and implement the best solutions. Ideally you have deep experience in React and single-page web apps, and experience/willingness to dive in on Next.js. Backend is Django/Postgres, infrastructure is AWS and we're very open to full-stack generalists provided the frontend skills are strong. Experience with Auth0, Prismic CMS, FB social plugin integrations, or SendGrid/email all helpful as well.


Where we're at:
Thespie is a disruptive model in our space, so continuing to improve the platform and deliver on our roadmap is essential. We're heads down on building and moving fast because we love what we do, and have big things we need to deliver to keep theatre audiences engaged while theatres are closed.

If the above sounds like you - or you're excited about what we're doing, please apply and/or connect! We love meeting new people interested in the problems we're solving.

jobs.title: Startup Internship (London)
jobs.description:
The role:
Working in a small, growing start-up involves exposure to all aspects of the business ­– from product and design, to marketing and operations, to resolving customer issues and fire drills. This role is an opportunity for a smart, curious generalist who has a demonstrated interest in working in a customer-centric technology company, to help create next-generation discovery and engagement tools for theatre-goers.
 
During your internship, you'll be leading key product and research activities working closely with the Founder/CEO, and taking on a wide variety of activities that help us build pre-launch momentum for our product. A sample day might include testing a feature with end customers, interview customers, drafting marketing content, or outlining requirements for new features on our future roadmap.

Who you will be:
- Passionate about people, with a desire to build something that effectively reaches customers of all ages and experience backgrounds. 
- A natural do-er with bias for action and a test-and-learn mentality.
- Constantly thinking about how to improve the things around you and pitching in wherever the team needs support.
- Have recently completed an undergraduate degree from a leading university, or are nearly complete.

What we offer:
Chance to join an early-stage technology start-up setting out to make a material a difference in the way people discover and engage with theatre.  
Paid Internship for up to three months.

We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, citizenship, disability, or veteran status.

jobs.title: Theatre Evangelist
jobs.description:
Thespie (https://thespie.com) is a startup reinventing how people discover live theatre experiences, and helping increase the number of tickets sold directly by theatres, which in turn helps artists and theatre-makers. We aim to remove barriers to entry for potential theatre-goers, help people see the right shows for their interests, and avoid ticket scams, high fees, and misleading information. Experiencing live theatre is more powerful than ever in today’s screen-driven society and we believe we can recruit more theatre-goers by building trustworthy tools for exploring and connecting with theatre.  

The role:
We’re looking for Theatre Evangelists, natural social connectors who can drive our on-the-ground work to build theatre audiences. You share our passion for theatre in all its vibrant diversity, and translate that into activities and programs that bridge between arts- and non-arts communities, and drive excitement and visibility for theatre. You also understand how to meet people at their level of experience, and can dial back your knowledge and enthusiasm to authentically connect with people new to (or skeptical of) theatre and help them see themselves at the right show for them.

You will run and help shape exciting programs (e.g. events, market stalls, partnerships, flyering) that directly engage real people about theatre; increase awareness of Thespie as a means to discover theatre experiences; and deepen our internal understanding of barriers to entry for theatre, both real (e.g. cost, distance, accessibility) and perceived (e.g. stigma, stereotypes) so we improve our approach over time.

Your creativity takes theatre into unexpected arenas and your passion helps people see theatre in an accessible, exciting light, supplementing our vision for Thespie as the most trusted way to access theatre.

You:
Passionate about all people, eager to get them to experience more theatre. A natural do-er: never afraid to get your hands dirty or have face-to-face customer conversations, while simplifying and helping us work toward our big vision.

Desired skills/experience:
- Broad knowledge of theatre, emerging/fringe work, dance, opera, immersive, spoken word --ability to explain these experiences simply to anyone
- Strong portfolio of sales, business development, PR, or marketing projects showcasing ability to build audiences, drive creative brand engagement, and/or secure press coverage
- Honest and direct with internal teams and leadership—never afraid to share real customer feedback/frustration and your personal perspective
- Impeccable communication with people of all ages and backgrounds

This is a part-time role with evening and weekend work required. We are looking for the right candidates to join the team based on capabilities, experience, and alignment with our mission, and will do our best to build schedules and programs around availability and accommodation needs.

We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, citizenship, disability, or veteran status.
